definition: to consider from all angles (idiom); to think hard/to rack one's brains
bitter/hardship/pain/to suffer/to bring suffering to/painstakingly
to think/to consider
dark/deep/stupid/the underworld
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)

sentences.english: The director noodled for two days for only one scene.
sentences.chinese: 就爲了一個鏡頭，導演苦思冥想了兩天時間。

sentences.english: Anxiously I ponder the ways I might reduce my shoe size.
sentences.chinese: 我苦思冥想怎麼才能縮小“鞋號”。

sentences.english: He strained to look for a good method to save his patient.
sentences.chinese: 他爲找出拯救病人生命的好方法而苦思冥想。

sentences.english: Meditation won’t miraculously erase your stress overnight.
sentences.chinese: 苦思冥想不會在一夜之間奇蹟般得消除你的壓力。

sentences.english: She tasked her mind with that.

definition: to consider from all angles (idiom); to think hard/to rack one's brains
to think hard/bitter thoughts/to pour out one's sufferings
to mull over (idiom)/to think long and hard
to rack one's brains
to turn over in one's mind (idiom); to think through from different angles/to ponder
to search one's guts and belly (idiom); to racks one's brains for a solution
to rack one's brains (for apt wording etc) (idiom)
to tweak one's ears and scratch one's cheeks (as an expression of anxiety, delight, frustration etc) (idiom)
brains
to fail to grasp the main points
to think deeply/to ponder
to consider past cause and future effect (idiom); to think over the past and future/to ponder over reasons and connection
to figure out/to work out (a solution etc)/to think up/to come up with (an idea etc)
to carve and polish (jade)/to polish and refine a literary work
to ponder/to mull over/to think through/Taiwan pr. [zhuo2 mo2]
see 百思不解[bai3 si1 bu4 jie3]
pinyin: bai3 si1 bu4 de2 qi2 jie3

definition: a bright idea suddenly occurs (idiom); to hit upon an inspiration/to be struck by a brainwave
